reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Strategic Development of Initiatives for Turtle Conservation in Oman

description.narrative: The purpose of this project, titled “Strategic Development of Initiatives for Marine Turtle Conservation in Oman”, is to assist with conservation efforts for loggerhead, green and hawksbill turtles in Oman. The Recipient will conduct hawksbill nest surveys at Daymaniyat Islands and loggerhead nest surveys at Masirah Island as well as conduct public awareness campaigns.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Elections in 2014 restored constitutional rule in Guinea-Bissau following the April 2012 coup d'. The new government, under the leadership of Prime Minister Domingos Sim'f5es Pereira, quickly secured support from the international community and embarked on an ambitious slate of reforms. President JosMVaz dismissed Sim'f5es Pereira's government in August 2015, and the subsequent political stalemate stalled progress of the reform program. The new government of Prime Minister Carlos Correia, established in October 2015, includes a number of ministers from the previous cabinet and will likely pursue the same reform objectives. Tensions between the government and President Vaz may resurface as a result of deep divisions within the ruling party. U.S. foreign policy goals are: support the development of a stable, democratic government; build effective government capacity to counter narcotics trafficking; and advance economic growth based on good governance and sound economic policy. FY 2017 U.S. foreign assistance to Guinea-Bissau focuses on professionalization of the country's military forces.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Multinational Species Conservation Fund, United States Fish and Wildlife Service
